To **drop** something is to remove it from your inventory and place it on the ground under you.

Sometimes it is impossible to drop items due to their [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status.

- Press [d](/wiki/D "D") to drop an item
- Press [D](/wiki/D "D") to drop several items

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"There are multiple different control schemes for the drop menu, and this section only describes one of them (which isn't the default on most builds) – it should explain how to drop items in each of the control schemes"*

If dropping multiple items, you will be given the option to select different categories of items to drop:

- - "What kinds of things do you want to drop? \[!%= BUCXaium]"

  - Options include:

    - - B - drop all objects known to be blessed.
      - U - drop all objects known to be uncursed.
      - C - drop all objects known to be cursed.
      - X - drop all objects of unknown B/U/C status.
      - a - drop all objects, without asking for confirmation.
      - i - examine your inventory before dropping anything.
      - u - drop only unpaid objects (when in a shop).
      - m - use a menu to pick which object(s) to drop.

You may also combine the options in a single [D](/wiki/D "D") command:

- - D%u - drop only unpaid food.

Pressing [-](/wiki/- "-") when asked what to drop produces the message, **"You mime dropping something."**

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Dropping part of a stack](#Dropping_part_of_a_stack)
- [2 Special Cases](#Special_Cases)
- [3 What to Drop](#What_to_Drop)
- [4 See Also](#See_Also)

## Dropping part of a stack

Sometimes, you have a large volume of a stackable item, and it would be useful to drop part of them, while keeping others. You can do this by combining the drop command with a number:

[d](/wiki/D "D")[1](/wiki/1 "1")[9](/wiki/9 "9")[$](/wiki/$ "$") will drop nineteen gold Zorkmids.

In Windows, you must check the box for the item you wish to drop, then type in a number.

This allows you to split a stack into two groups (the part on the ground and the part in your main inventory). This is particularly useful for fragile objects, since throwing them (another way to split a stack) causes potions to break.

## Special Cases

- It is not possible to drop a cursed [loadstone](/wiki/Loadstone "Loadstone") or a cursed [weapon](/wiki/Weapon "Weapon") or [weapon-tool](/wiki/Weapon-tool "Weapon-tool") that you are wielding (though other cursed wielded items may be dropped freely).
- It is not possible to drop any worn [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor")
- While levitating, the item is dropped from a height; if the item is [fragile](/wiki/Fragile "Fragile"), it may shatter.
- While walking on [water](/wiki/Water "Water") or [lava](/wiki/Lava "Lava"), dropped items will sink.
- Items dropped on a down [staircase](/wiki/Staircase "Staircase") may fall down, as may other items on that square. You might need to try a few times. Dropping items in this way prevents you falling down the stairs if they would burden you, and allows you to move heavy items that would make you stressed (e.g. sacrifice corpses) into lower levels.
- If you drop an item in a [shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop"), the shopkeeper will offer you gold for the item if he is interested. If you drop gold in a shop, the amount will be added to your credit.

## What to Drop

Dropping items is often necessary since carrying too much weight will cause the player to become [burdened](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance"). The player's pack only has a limited amount of space, too -- in most cases, only enough room for two different items for each letter of the alphabet. A **[stash](/wiki/Stash "Stash")** is a collection of items you want to access later; see that page for detailed strategy.

- When [encumbered](/wiki/Encumbrance "Encumbrance"), look through your [inventory](/wiki/Inventory "Inventory") for [junk](/wiki/Junk "Junk") you can drop to regain full speed.
- It is also possible to run out of knapsack slots, forcing you to drop items to free up space for better items
- Drop food to feed your pets. This especially applies to [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") that would break if [thrown](/wiki/Thrown "Thrown"), or if you are on a [mount](/wiki/Mount "Mount").
- Drop an item so your pet can curse test it. If your pet will not walk on an ordinary square, then one item on that square is cursed
- Drop items on an [altar](/wiki/Altar "Altar") to learn their [BUC](/wiki/BUC "BUC") status
- Drop a [scroll of scare monster](/wiki/Scroll_of_scare_monster "Scroll of scare monster") to [scare](/wiki/Scare "Scare") all monsters in visual range
- If you suffer an [unfortunate polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") you may need to drop most of your stuff before you can move

## See Also

- *[death drop](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop")*: items that monsters drop after the player kills them,
- [throw](/wiki/Throw "Throw")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/b/b0/Nh343-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Drop

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Keyboard commands
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ = +
Q W E R T Y U I O P { } |
q w e r t y u i o p [ ] \
A S D F G H J K L : "
a s d f g h j k l ; '
Z X C V B N M < > ?
z x c v b n m , . /
q w e r t u i o p Alt
a s d f j l Alt
c v n m ? Alt
A C R T O Alt
a c d o p r t [ Ctrl

To drop something is to remove it from your inventory and place it on the ground under you.

Sometimes it is impossible to drop items due to their BUC status.

  • Press d to drop an item
  • Press D to drop several items

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"There are multiple different control schemes for the drop menu, and this section only describes one of them (which isn't the default on most builds) – it should explain how to drop items in each of the control schemes"

If dropping multiple items, you will be given the option to select different categories of items to drop:

"What kinds of things do you want to drop? [!%= BUCXaium]"
Options include:
B - drop all objects known to be blessed.
U - drop all objects known to be uncursed.
C - drop all objects known to be cursed.
X - drop all objects of unknown B/U/C status.
a - drop all objects, without asking for confirmation.
i - examine your inventory before dropping anything.
u - drop only unpaid objects (when in a shop).
m - use a menu to pick which object(s) to drop.

You may also combine the options in a single D command:

D%u - drop only unpaid food.

Pressing - when asked what to drop produces the message, "You mime dropping something."

Contents

  • 1 Dropping part of a stack
  • 2 Special Cases
  • 3 What to Drop
  • 4 See Also

Dropping part of a stack

Sometimes, you have a large volume of a stackable item, and it would be useful to drop part of them, while keeping others. You can do this by combining the drop command with a number:

d19$ will drop nineteen gold Zorkmids.

In Windows, you must check the box for the item you wish to drop, then type in a number.

This allows you to split a stack into two groups (the part on the ground and the part in your main inventory). This is particularly useful for fragile objects, since throwing them (another way to split a stack) causes potions to break.

Special Cases

  • It is not possible to drop a cursed loadstone or a cursed weapon or weapon-tool that you are wielding (though other cursed wielded items may be dropped freely).
  • It is not possible to drop any worn armor
  • While levitating, the item is dropped from a height; if the item is fragile, it may shatter.
  • While walking on water or lava, dropped items will sink.
  • Items dropped on a down staircase may fall down, as may other items on that square. You might need to try a few times. Dropping items in this way prevents you falling down the stairs if they would burden you, and allows you to move heavy items that would make you stressed (e.g. sacrifice corpses) into lower levels.
  • If you drop an item in a shop, the shopkeeper will offer you gold for the item if he is interested. If you drop gold in a shop, the amount will be added to your credit.

What to Drop

Dropping items is often necessary since carrying too much weight will cause the player to become burdened. The player's pack only has a limited amount of space, too -- in most cases, only enough room for two different items for each letter of the alphabet. A stash is a collection of items you want to access later; see that page for detailed strategy.

  • When encumbered, look through your inventory for junk you can drop to regain full speed.
  • It is also possible to run out of knapsack slots, forcing you to drop items to free up space for better items
  • Drop food to feed your pets. This especially applies to eggs that would break if thrown, or if you are on a mount.
  • Drop an item so your pet can curse test it. If your pet will not walk on an ordinary square, then one item on that square is cursed
  • Drop items on an altar to learn their BUC status
  • Drop a scroll of scare monster to scare all monsters in visual range
  • If you suffer an unfortunate polymorph you may need to drop most of your stuff before you can move

See Also

  • death drop: items that monsters drop after the player kills them,
  • throw

This page may need to be updated for the current version of NetHack.

It may contain text specific to NetHack 3.4.3. Information on this page may be out of date.

Editors: After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

rawPage:
{{Keyboard Commands}}
To '''drop''' something is to remove it from your inventory and place it on the ground under you.  

Sometimes it is impossible to drop items due to their [[BUC]] status.

* Press {{kbd|d}} to drop an item
* Press {{kbd|D}} to drop several items

{{todo|There are multiple different control schemes for the drop menu, and this section only describes one of them (which isn't the default on most builds) – it should explain how to drop items in each of the control schemes}}
If dropping multiple items, you will be given the option to select different categories of items to drop:
:"What kinds of things do you want to drop? [!%= BUCXaium]"
:Options include:
::B - drop all objects known to be blessed.
::U - drop all objects known to be uncursed.
::C - drop all objects known to be cursed.
::X - drop all objects of unknown B/U/C status.
::a - drop all objects, without asking for confirmation.
::i - examine your inventory before dropping anything.
::u - drop only unpaid objects (when in a shop).
::m - use a menu to pick which object(s) to drop.

You may also combine the options in a single {{kbd|D}} command:
::D%u - drop only unpaid food.

Pressing {{kbd|-}} when asked what to drop produces the message, '''"You mime dropping something."'''

== Dropping part of a stack ==
Sometimes, you have a large volume of a stackable item, and it would be useful to drop part of them, while keeping others.  You can do this by combining the drop command with a number:

{{kbd|d}}{{kbd|1}}{{kbd|9}}{{kbd|$}} will drop nineteen gold Zorkmids.

In Windows, you must check the box for the item you wish to drop, then type in a number. 

This allows you to split a stack into two groups (the part on the ground and the part in your main inventory).  This is particularly useful for fragile objects, since throwing them (another way to split a stack) causes potions to break.

== Special Cases ==
* It is not possible to drop a cursed [[loadstone]] or a cursed [[weapon]] or [[weapon-tool]] that you are wielding (though other cursed wielded items may be dropped freely).
* It is not possible to drop any worn [[armor]]
* While levitating, the item is dropped from a height; if the item is [[fragile]], it may shatter.
* While walking on [[water]] or [[lava]], dropped items will sink.
* Items dropped on a down [[staircase]] may fall down, as may other items on that square. You might need to try a few times. Dropping items in this way prevents you falling down the stairs if they would burden you, and allows you to move heavy items that would make you stressed (e.g. sacrifice corpses) into lower levels.
* If you drop an item in a [[shop]], the shopkeeper will offer you gold for the item if he is interested. If you drop gold in a shop, the amount will be added to your credit.

== What to Drop ==
Dropping items is often necessary since carrying too much weight will cause the player to become [[Encumbrance|burdened]]. The player's pack only has a limited amount of space, too -- in most cases, only enough room for two different items for each letter of the alphabet. A '''[[stash]]''' is a collection of items you want to access later; see that page for detailed strategy.

* When [[encumbrance|encumbered]], look through your [[inventory]] for [[junk]] you can drop to regain full speed.
* It is also possible to run out of knapsack slots, forcing you to drop items to free up space for better items
* Drop food to feed your pets. This especially applies to [[egg]]s that would break if [[thrown]], or if you are on a [[mount]].
* Drop an item so your pet can curse test it. If your pet will not walk on an ordinary square, then one item on that square is cursed
* Drop items on an [[altar]] to learn their [[BUC]] status
* Drop a [[scroll of scare monster]] to [[scare]] all monsters in visual range
* If you suffer an [[polymorph trap|unfortunate polymorph]] you may need to drop most of your stuff before you can move

==See Also==
* ''[[death drop]]'': items that monsters drop after the player kills them,
* [[throw]]
